source: The open protocol for real-time sync to client applications
lemma: the open protocol for real-time sync to client applications
definitions: A standardized set of rules and procedures that enables immediate, continuous synchronization of data and updates from a server to various client-side applications.
A technical specification that outlines how data should be exchanged and kept consistent in real-time between a backend system and multiple client applications.
A framework or agreement that facilitates instant data consistency across distributed client applications by defining communication methods and data structures.
examples: The open protocol for real-time sync to client applications ensures data consistency.
Developers adopted the open protocol for real-time sync to client applications.
Understanding the open protocol for real-time sync to client applications is crucial.
